narrative.title: 11-2 — Cars Uncoupled
paragraphs: They pressed the attack across shifting toys and began to stumble. Flops managed to grab a corner of the blanket—then the cars separate suddenly. The pull ripped the fabric, leaving only a patch as the loose cars rolled to an awkward sway and came to a grinding halt in a bleak stretch of nowhere. Cold air met them, and Theadora thought of the child’s shivering hands.

vocabulary.definition: to trip or nearly fall while walking.
examples: He stumbled on the steps in the dark.
Don’t stumble over the toys on the floor.
She grabbed the railing to steady herself.
Grab your coat before we go.
The teams separated after the game.
The river separates the two towns.
His shirt was ripped on the branch.
The bag ripped and apples rolled out.

vocabulary.definition: cloth or material made by weaving or knitting.
examples: The fabric felt soft and warm.
This fabric is too thin for winter.

vocabulary.definition: not tight or fixed in place.
examples: The lid is loose; tighten it.
He wore loose pants for comfort.
She made an awkward turn and bumped the table.
The bus came to a halt at the light.
Rain brought the game to a halt.

events.text: The fight shifted across uneven toys, throwing off their balance.
Someone caught a corner of the blanket before disaster struck.
The train cars split apart mid-battle.
Only a small piece of the blanket remained after the tear.
The detached cars rolled to a stop in a bleak place.

distractors: A guard returned the blanket politely.
A bridge crew rescued them immediately.
